intro: Volutarella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Volutarella is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed habitats. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
